actor_awards.notes: Best known for his portrayal of Sherlock Holmes in 14 Hollywood films. He received Academy Award nominations for Best Supporting Actor for Romeo and Juliet (1936) and If I Were King (1938). He won a Tony Award for Best Actor in a Play for The Heiress (1947). He was also a decorated hero of World War I, earning the Military Cross.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: The treacherous and ambitious Norman knight who serves as Prince John's primary enforcer and Robin Hood's arch-nemesis.
filmography.plot: When Prince John attempts to seize the throne of England, the outlaw Robin Hood fights back to protect the people and return King Richard to power.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Film Editing, Best Original Score

filmography.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
filmography.role_description: The brilliant detective who travels to the moors to investigate a supernatural curse plaguing the Baskerville family. This was Rathbone's first outing as Holmes.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

filmography.title: Captain Blood
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant and ruthless French pirate captain who forms a tenuous alliance with Peter Blood.
filmography.plot: A doctor is wrongly convicted of treason and sold into slavery, eventually becoming a pirate captain in the Caribbean.

filmography.title: The Mark of Zorro
filmography.role_description: The arrogant and skilled fencing master who serves as the primary antagonist to Zorro.
filmography.plot: A young aristocrat masquerades as a fop by day and a masked vigilante by night to fight corruption in old California.

filmography.title: Romeo and Juliet
filmography.role_description: Juliet's fiery cousin whose aggressive nature leads to a fatal duel with Mercutio.
filmography.plot: Two young lovers from feuding families fall in love, leading to tragedy in Verona.

filmography.title: If I Were King
filmography.role_description: The wily and eccentric King of France who plays a game of wits with the poet François Villon.
filmography.plot: A poet boasts that he could rule France better than the King, and the King decides to let him try for a week.

filmography.title: David Copperfield
filmography.role_description: The cruel and abusive stepfather of young David Copperfield.
filmography.plot: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

filmography.title: Son of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: The son of the monster's creator who returns to his ancestral castle and tries to clear his father's name.
filmography.plot: Frankenstein's son revives his father's creation with the help of a broken-necked shepherd named Ygor.

filmography.title: A Tale of Two Cities
filmography.role_description: A cold and unfeeling French aristocrat representing the tyranny of the old regime.
filmography.plot: During the French Revolution, a British lawyer defends a man who is the look-alike of a French aristocrat.

filmography.title: Anna Karenina
filmography.role_description: The cold, bureaucratic husband of Anna who is more concerned with his social standing than her happiness.
filmography.plot: A married Russian aristocrat enters into a life-changing affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Foreign Film

filmography.title: The Dawn Patrol
filmography.role_description: A WWI flight commander pushed to the breaking point by the high casualty rates of his young pilots.
filmography.plot: A flight commander in World War I is pushed to the breaking point by the high casualty rate of his men.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
filmography.role_description: Holmes battles his arch-nemesis Professor Moriarty in this second film of the Fox series.
filmography.plot: The master detective must stop his arch-nemesis, Professor Moriarty, from stealing the Crown Jewels.

filmography.title: The Court Jester
filmography.role_description: The villainous nobleman who schemes against the throne and engages in a comedic duel with Danny Kaye.
filmography.plot: A hapless carnival performer disguises himself as the court jester as part of a plot against an evil ruler.

filmography.title: The Scarlet Claw
filmography.role_description: Often cited as the best of the Universal Holmes films, he investigates a supernatural marsh monster.
filmography.plot: Holmes and Watson investigate a series of murders in a Canadian village that the locals attribute to a legendary phantom.

filmography.title: Tower of London
filmography.role_description: The scheming Duke who murders his way to the throne to become Richard III.
filmography.plot: Richard, Duke of Gloucester, eliminates those ahead of him in line for the throne with the help of his executioner.

filmography.title: We're No Angels
filmography.role_description: The miserly and cruel uncle who becomes the antagonist to three escaped convicts.
filmography.plot: Three escaped convicts from Devil's Island hide out in the home of a kindly merchant and decide to help him out.

filmography.title: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
filmography.role_description: Holmes protects a Swiss scientist and his bomb sight invention from the Nazis.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes must protect a Swiss scientist who has invented a new bomb sight from falling into the hands of the Nazis and Professor Moriarty.

filmography.title: The Pearl of Death
filmography.role_description: Holmes investigates a series of murders linked to a stolen pearl and a monstrous creeper.
filmography.plot: When a valuable pearl is stolen and a series of murders ensues, Holmes must outwit a criminal mastermind.

filmography.title: The Spider Woman
filmography.role_description: Holmes fakes his own death to catch a female mastermind who uses poisonous spiders.
filmography.plot: Holmes investigates a series of apparent suicides dubbed the 'Pajama Suicides' and discovers a deadly female antagonist.

filmography.title: The House of Fear
filmography.role_description: Holmes investigates a club of wealthy men who are being murdered one by one.
filmography.plot: Members of a club for wealthy men are being killed off, and Holmes is called in to find the murderer before the insurance money is collected.

filmography.title: Tales of Terror
filmography.role_description: A mesmerist who hypnotizes a dying man in this adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe's stories.
filmography.plot: Three tales of terror based on the stories of Edgar Allan Poe, starring Vincent Price, Peter Lorre, and Basil Rathbone.

filmography.title: The Last Days of Pompeii
filmography.role_description: The Roman prefect of Judaea in this historical drama.
filmography.plot: A blacksmith strives to become wealthy as a gladiator and arena promoter, but his life is changed by the eruption of Vesuvius and a meeting with Christ.

filmography.title: The Comedy of Terrors
filmography.role_description: A wealthy landlord who suffers from catalepsy and is targeted by inept undertakers.
filmography.plot: Two unscrupulous undertakers try to drum up business by killing people, but their plan backfires when they target a man who won't stay dead.

filmography.title: The Woman in Green
filmography.role_description: Holmes investigates the 'Finger Murders' involving a hypnosis scheme.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes investigates a series of murders of young women where the killer cuts off a finger from each victim.

filmography.title: Terror by Night
filmography.role_description: Holmes guards a diamond on a train journey and must find a killer among the passengers.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes is hired to protect a valuable diamond on a train trip from London to Edinburgh, but the jewel is stolen and the owner murdered.

filmography.title: Dressed to Kill
filmography.role_description: Rathbone's final film performance as Holmes, involving a hunt for stolen bank plates hidden in music boxes.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson track down three music boxes that contain the code for stolen bank printing plates.

filmography.title: Sherlock Holmes in Washington
filmography.role_description: Holmes travels to Washington D.C. to find a missing microfilm.
filmography.plot: Holmes and Watson go to Washington D.C. to find a missing microfilm document before it falls into the hands of a spy ring.

filmography.title: Sherlock Holmes Faces Death
filmography.role_description: Holmes investigates murders at a convalescent home for officers, based on 'The Musgrave Ritual'.
filmography.plot: Holmes investigates a series of murders at a convalescent home where Dr. Watson is volunteering.

filmography.title: Pursuit to Algiers
filmography.role_description: Holmes escorts the heir to a foreign throne on a ship voyage.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson escort a king back to his home country, trying to protect him from assassins on board a cruise ship.

filmography.title: Sherlock Holmes and the Voice of Terror
filmography.role_description: The first of the Universal series, where Holmes fights Nazi saboteurs broadcasting propaganda.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson are recruited by British Intelligence to find the source of a Nazi radio broadcast.

filmography.title: Kind Lady
filmography.role_description: A charming but sinister con artist who takes over the home of a wealthy woman.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is held prisoner in her own home by a clever criminal and his gang who pose as her relatives.

filmography.title: Love from a Stranger
filmography.role_description: A man who marries a lottery winner, who then begins to suspect he is a murderer.
filmography.plot: After winning the lottery, a woman marries a charming stranger, but soon suspects he may have a dark past.

filmography.title: The Magic Sword
filmography.role_description: An evil sorcerer who captures a princess and challenges St. George.
filmography.plot: The son of a sorceress must save a princess from an evil wizard, armed with a magic sword and shield.

filmography.title: Frenchman's Creek
filmography.role_description: A lecherous nobleman who pursues the heroine.
filmography.plot: An English noblewoman falls in love with a French pirate, seeking adventure away from her boring husband.
